item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, January 27, 2025 at 8:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Show HN: Making AR experiences is still painful – had to make my own editor (20 points | discuss)
2. Openhaystack: Build 'AirTags' – track Bluetooth devices via Apple's network (225 points | 46 comments)
3. Lessons in creating family photos that people want to keep (2018) (181 points | 57 comments)
4. Hedy: Textual programming made easy (39 points | 2 comments)
5. Show HN: Bagels – TUI expense tracker (94 points | 23 comments)
6. Hard numbers in the Wayland vs. X11 input latency discussion (443 points | 316 comments)
7. Supercharge SQLite with Ruby Functions (20 points | 1 comment)
8. Using generative AI as part of historical research: three case studies (196 points | 158 comments)
9. Shunpo: Minimalist bash tool to make directory navigation a little bit faster (66 points | 26 comments)
10. Show HN: 3D printing giant things with a Python jigsaw generator (94 points | 15 comments)
11. Qwen2.5-1M: Deploy your own Qwen with context length up to 1M tokens (193 points | 76 comments)
12. Marginalia – A search engine that prioritizes non-commercial content (328 points | 27 comments)
13. Using the most unhinged AVX-512 instruction to make fastest phrase search algo (156 points | 36 comments)
14. OpenJazz is a free, open-source version of the classic Jazz Jackrabbit games (101 points | 15 comments)
15. The impact of competition and DeepSeek on Nvidia (183 points | 91 comments)
16. Amsterdam Compiler Kit for Cray X-MP (71 points | 8 comments)
17. Interview with Andy Yen, CEO of Proton VPN (58 points | 38 comments)
18. So you wanna write Kubernetes controllers? (139 points | 75 comments)
19. Wikenigma – An Encyclopedia of Unknowns (29 points | 3 comments)
20. Astronomers delete asteroid because it turned out to be Tesla Roadster (206 points | 66 comments)
21. Why Liquidity Matters (8 points | discuss)
22. Autodesk partially restores old forum posts (56 points | 9 comments)
23. Hyperbound (YC S23) is hiring a Founding Account Executive in SF ( | hide)
24. EV maker Canoo, once worth $2.4B, files for bankruptcy (48 points | 35 comments)
25. If OpenSSL were a GUI (2022) (129 points | 41 comments)
26. Dualities in functional programming (56 points | 7 comments)
27. No one is disrupting banks – at least not the big ones (124 points | 208 comments)
28. Show HN: DeepSeek My User Agent (280 points | 109 comments)
29. Kansas tuberculosis outbreak is America's largest recorded since the 1950s (360 points | 283 comments)
30. Purelymail: Cheap, no-nonsense email (220 points | 126 comments)
